intro: Rhamphicarpa australiensis, commonly known as the Australian horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped seed pods. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
